fields.name: Pipe_Bridge_Disclaimer_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
Please escalate any high risk defects or issues with the pipe bridge or surrounding infrastructure and note in the job closure.


For any additional information please see SOP number 205788

value.stringValue: Access Deterrent Measures (if present or lack of)

fields.name: Height_of_fall_Likelihood_of_Injury
fields.fieldText: Height of fall (Likelihood of Injury)?

fields.name: Height_of_fall_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
ℹ️ This is the height of the top of the pipe from the furthest point of surface below (water/ground etc.) 

This is based on the assumption that the injury sustained is likely to be greater the distance fallen and does not consider whether the ground is soft or hard. 

Also this assumes that any security if present is breached, so worst case scenario.

fields.name: HeightOfFallComments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Vegetation_Measuring
fields.fieldText: Vegetation Measuring

fields.name: Vegetation_Measuring_Display_Text
fields.fieldText: ℹ️ Vegetation can affect the structural stability of the pipe bridge. It can also make visual assessment of the pipe bridge difficult.

fields.name: Vegetation_Measuring_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: What_is_the_condition_of_the_pipe_itself
fields.fieldText: What is the condition of the pipe itself?

fields.name: What_is_the_condition_of_the_pipe_itself_Display_Text
fields.fieldText: ℹ️ Assets on the pipe bridge can mean that they can not be safely accessed and therefore maintained.

fields.name: What_is_the_condition_of_the_pipe_itself_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Pipe_bridge_Safety_Signs_Fitted
fields.fieldText: Pipe bridge Safety Signs Fitted?

fields.name: Pipe_bridge_Safety_Signs_Fitted_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
ℹ️ Signage should be installed on all pipe bridges. 

There may be a few exceptions where it is physically not possible or safe to install but where this is the case often signs can be installed nearby giving the same warning. 

Signs are available from H&S Reps and should be taken on site inspections in case signs need replacing. 

If it is not safe to install but required raise to supervisor for advice on how to do safely.

fields.name: PipeBridgeSafetyComments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Fencing_to_prevent_access_What_type_of_fencing
fields.fieldText: Fencing (to prevent access). What type of fencing?

fields.name: Fencing_Dsiplay_Text
fields.fieldText:
ℹ️ Fencing may be installed on some pipe bridges. 

The need for fencing will need to be assessed based on the risk but will be generally where the consequence is high i.e. rail crossings / high fall and likelihood is sufficient. 

Fencing comes in different styles and palisade fencing is most secure with post and rail less secure and can be climbed. 

Fencing may require planning permission and land agreements.

fields.name: TypeOfFencingComments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Presence_of_and_Condition_of_Access_Deterrent_Measures_ADM_fitted_such_as_fans_e
fields.fieldText: Presence of and Condition of Access Deterrent Measures (ADM) fitted such as fans etc?

fields.name: Presence_of_and_Condition_of_Access_Deterrent_Measures_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
ℹ️ There are a number of different types of Access Deterrent Measure ADM.  

Most pipe bridges will have some form of access deterrent measure, and those that don't probably require it.  

This section is to determine if what is there is sufficient and what condition it is in .﻿

fields.name: Presence_of_and_Condition_of_Access_Deterrent_Measures_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Access_to_Pipe_Ends_Is_it_possible_to_climb
fields.fieldText: Access to Pipe Ends (Is it possible to climb).

fields.name: Access_to_Pipe_End1_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
ℹ️ Access to the end of the pipe may be possible, but with suitable precautions makes it difficult to cross and therefore deters people from doing so. 

- End 1 has been determined as the end from which the flows begin

fields.name: Access_to_Pipe_End1_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Access_to_Pipe_End2_Is_it_possible_to_climb
fields.fieldText: Access to Pipe Ends (Is it possible to climb).

fields.name: Access_to_Pipe_End2_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
ℹ️ Access to the end of the pipe may be possible, but with suitable precautions makes it difficult to cross and therefore deters people from doing so. 

- End 2 has been determined as the end where flows go to

fields.name: Access_to_Pipe_End2_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Signs_of_Vandalism_Evidence_of_unauthorised_access
fields.fieldText: Signs of Vandalism (Evidence of unauthorised access)

fields.name: Signs_of_Vandalism_Dsiplay_Text
fields.fieldText: ℹ️ Vandalism includes damage to the pipe and it's ancillary assets as well as signs of graffiti.

fields.name: Signs_of_Vandalism_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Does_the_pipe_bridge_appear_safe
fields.fieldText: Does the pipe bridge appear safe?

fields.name: Does_the_pipe_bridge_appear_safe_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: Does_the_structure_piers_supports_not_the_pipe_appear_in_good_condition
fields.fieldText: Does the structure (piers/supports - not the pipe) appear in good condition?

fields.name: Does_the_structure_appear_in_good_condition_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
ℹ️ This is the pipe supports and foundations condition (not the security devices or the pipe itself this will be looked at later) 

We are not asking the Ops to carry out a structural assessment as this will be done by others, but to advise if there are any visible concerns.

fields.name: Does_the_structure_appear_in_good_condition_Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments

fields.name: ErrorMessagePhotos
fields.fieldText: Please make sure you upload all the photos.

fields.name: WorkStep_is_already_Completed_Do_you_still_want_to_fill_the_form_again
fields.fieldText: WorkStep is already Completed . Do you still want to fill the form again ?

value.stringValue: Access Deterrent Measures (if present or lack of)
